SENT.plain: An 11-year-old boy with severe aplastic anemia underwent unrelated BMT following TBI, antithymocyte globulin and CY
On day +23, CMV antigenemia was detected which resolved with ganciclovir
Eight days after discontinuing ganciclovir, he complained of impaired visual acuity

Ophthalmologic findings and a positive PCR study using anterior chamber fluid from the right eye confirmed the presumptive diagnosis of CMV retinitis, although CMV antigenemia and PCR studies using PBMC were then negative
He was successfully re-treated with ganciclovir
CMV retinitis should be considered even when CMV antigenemia is not present or PCR using PBMC is negative
